PAD_Mannequin_Doublet_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Mannequin_Doublet_0.text: This disguise... I remember it. We all had to wear it, for training. Horrible, itchy thing.
PAD_Mannequin_Doublet_0.context: NodeContext: Stirred memory upon looking at a tunic on a mannequin.

AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_004_0.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_004_0.text: This may prove to be a mistake, I fear. A dreadful mistake.
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_004_0.context: NodeContext: Concerned, Thinking out loud to self in the aftermath of a coup attempt against the Shar Cult, in which she threw her lot in with the instigators and helped defeat the leader. Now experiencing some doubts

AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_004_1.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_004_1.text: What if Lady Shar still supported the Mother Superior? What if we were misled?
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_004_1.context: NodeContext: Concerned, Thinking out loud to self in the aftermath of a coup attempt against the Shar Cult, in which she threw her lot in with the instigators and helped defeat the leader. Now experiencing some doubts

AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_004_2.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_004_2.text: But... she didn't aid us either. Not in any way I comprehended...
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_004_2.context: NodeContext: Concerned, Thinking out loud to self in the aftermath of a coup attempt against the Shar Cult, in which she threw her lot in with the instigators and helped defeat the leader. Now experiencing some doubts

AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_004_3.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_004_3.text: No... surely the Dark Lady would have aided the Mother Superior, had that been true.
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_004_3.context: NodeContext: Concerned, Thinking out loud to self in the aftermath of a coup attempt against the Shar Cult, in which she threw her lot in with the instigators and helped defeat the leader. Now experiencing some doubts

PAD_Mannequin_FancyDress_1.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Mannequin_FancyDress_1.text: This fabric... I think I attended a ball, once. Infiltrated it, rather.
PAD_Mannequin_FancyDress_1.context: NodeContext: Memory stirred by the sight of a dress used on a former mission

PAD_Mannequin_FancyDress_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Mannequin_FancyDress_0.text: The Mother Superior even gave me elocution lessons. Helped me blend in.
PAD_Mannequin_FancyDress_0.context: NodeContext: Memory stirred by the sight of a dress used on a former mission. 'what was the mission? = SH abandoned Shar. 'the Mother Superior' = SH loyal to Shar

PAD_CalimportLetter_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_CalimportLetter_0.text: Mother Superior seemed to travel a lot, before this place. She seemed to remember that time fondly...

AD_ViconiaSermon_1.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_ViconiaSermon_1.text: Those who cling to light are destined to lose it. Candles will gutter. Hearths will burn low. The stars will dim.
AD_ViconiaSermon_1.context: NodeContext: Preaching to a gathering of Shar worshippers

AD_ViconiaSermon_2.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_ViconiaSermon_2.text: Shed no tears for such fools. They are unworthy of Lady Shar's truth, and doom themselves.
AD_ViconiaSermon_2.context: NodeContext: Preaching to a gathering of Shar worshippers

AD_ViconiaSermon_6.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_ViconiaSermon_6.text: We shall leave them behind. The Nightsinger shall lead us to our reward.
AD_ViconiaSermon_6.context: NodeContext: Preaching to a gathering of Shar worshippers

AD_ViconiaSermon_16.speaker: Sharran Novice Humboldt
AD_ViconiaSermon_16.text: There can be no reward without loss. No salvation without sacrifice.
AD_ViconiaSermon_16.context: NodeContext: Solemn conviction. Uttered during a sermon/guided prayer being conducted by the chief Sharran,

AD_ViconiaSermon_12.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Owltalon
AD_ViconiaSermon_12.text: Lady Shar smiles upon our endeavours.
AD_ViconiaSermon_12.context: NodeContext: Solemn conviction. Uttered during a sermon/guided prayer being conducted by the chief Sharran,

AD_ViconiaSermon_5.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_ViconiaSermon_5.text: Each of you has suffered in your own way and sought out the Nightsinger.
AD_ViconiaSermon_5.context: NodeContext: Preaching to a gathering of Shar worshippers

AD_ViconiaSermon_11.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_ViconiaSermon_11.text: The gift of loss will soothe all woes, but only for those who deserve it.
AD_ViconiaSermon_11.context: NodeContext: Preaching to a gathering of Shar worshippers

AD_ViconiaSermon_4.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_ViconiaSermon_4.text: Assure your place at her side. Serve her to your last breath, and you shall have no fear of death.
AD_ViconiaSermon_4.context: NodeContext: Preaching to a gathering of Shar worshippers

AD_ViconiaSermon_9.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_ViconiaSermon_9.text: There is no fear but the fear of failing the Nightsinger.
AD_ViconiaSermon_9.context: NodeContext: Solemn conviction. Uttered during a sermon/guided prayer being conducted by the chief Sharran,

AD_ViconiaSermon_18.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
AD_ViconiaSermon_18.text: Lady Shar watches our every step.
AD_ViconiaSermon_18.context: NodeContext: Solemn conviction. Uttered during a sermon/guided prayer being conducted by the chief Sharran,

AD_ViconiaSermon_7.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_ViconiaSermon_7.text: Together, we shall watch light be snuffed from the world, with joy in our hearts.
AD_ViconiaSermon_7.context: NodeContext: Preaching to a gathering of Shar worshippers

AD_ViconiaSermon_0.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_ViconiaSermon_0.text: We shall be robed in black satin, and embraced by Lady Shar, beneath an extinguished sun.
AD_ViconiaSermon_0.context: NodeContext: Preaching to a gathering of Shar worshippers

AD_ViconiaSermon_15.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_ViconiaSermon_15.text: All burdens shall be lifted. All pains forgotten. We shall be free.
AD_ViconiaSermon_15.context: NodeContext: Preaching to a gathering of Shar worshippers

AD_ViconiaSermon_19.speaker: Sharran Novice Monteith
AD_ViconiaSermon_19.text: Free from light. Free from pain. Free from all burdens.
AD_ViconiaSermon_19.context: NodeContext: Solemn conviction. Uttered during a sermon/guided prayer being conducted by the chief Sharran,

AD_ViconiaSermon_14.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_ViconiaSermon_14.text: Lady Shar shall restore us to our purest form.
AD_ViconiaSermon_14.context: NodeContext: Solemn conviction. Uttered during a sermon/guided prayer being conducted by the chief Sharran,

AD_ViconiaSermon_17.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_ViconiaSermon_17.text: Lady Shar's darkness awaits us all - but how shall you meet it?
AD_ViconiaSermon_17.context: NodeContext: Preaching to a gathering of Shar worshippers

AD_ViconiaSermon_8.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_ViconiaSermon_8.text: When the time comes, shall you be embraced by the dark, or devoured by it?
AD_ViconiaSermon_8.context: NodeContext: Preaching to a gathering of Shar worshippers

AD_ViconiaSermon_13.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_ViconiaSermon_13.text: Only your actions can determine your reward... or punishment.
AD_ViconiaSermon_13.context: NodeContext: Preaching to a gathering of Shar worshippers

AD_ViconiaSermon_3.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Gydd
AD_ViconiaSermon_3.text: We shall serve. We shall be embraced.
AD_ViconiaSermon_3.context: NodeContext: Solemn conviction. Uttered during a sermon/guided prayer being conducted by the chief Sharran,

AD_ViconiaSermon_10.speaker: Sharran Novice Monteith
AD_ViconiaSermon_10.context: NodeContext: Solemn conviction. Uttered during a sermon/guided prayer being conducted by the chief Sharran,

AD_JusticiarSermon_1.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_JusticiarSermon_1.text: Rejoice, kin! Lady Shar has cleansed her church, and deemed us worthy.
AD_JusticiarSermon_1.context: NodeContext: Preaching to other Sharrans. Fired-up and pious

AD_JusticiarSermon_6.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_JusticiarSermon_6.text: A new leader, and a new era. Praise the Nightsinger!
AD_JusticiarSermon_6.context: NodeContext: Preaching to other Sharrans. Fired-up and pious

AD_JusticiarSermon_2.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_JusticiarSermon_2.text: With the faithless stripped from our ranks, we can concentrate on serving the Dark Lady.
AD_JusticiarSermon_2.context: NodeContext: Preaching to other Sharrans. Fired-up and pious

AD_JusticiarSermon_7.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_JusticiarSermon_7.text: Her embrace is closer than ever. Can you not feel it?
AD_JusticiarSermon_7.context: NodeContext: Preaching to other Sharrans. Fired-up and pious

AD_JusticiarSermon_3.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_JusticiarSermon_3.text: Let us pray for our new leader, kin. May she guide us to to Lady Shar's ultimate victory.
AD_JusticiarSermon_3.context: NodeContext: Preaching to other Sharrans. Fired-up and pious

AD_JusticiarSermon_5.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_JusticiarSermon_5.text: It shall come to pass. As sure as night shall fall.
AD_JusticiarSermon_5.context: NodeContext: Preaching to other Sharrans. Fired-up and pious

AD_JusticiarSermon_4.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_JusticiarSermon_4.text: I knew, the moment I heard her speak. Lady Shadowheart is destined to lead us.
AD_JusticiarSermon_4.context: NodeContext: Preaching to other Sharrans. Fired-up and pious

AD_JusticiarSermon_0.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_JusticiarSermon_0.text: The Nightsinger has blessed her, and given her power beyond measure. She is the future.
AD_JusticiarSermon_0.context: NodeContext: Preaching to other Sharrans. Fired-up and pious

Cultist_000_0.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Gydd
Cultist_000_0.text: What possessed you to actually come back here? You should have vanished.

Cultist_000_1.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Gydd
Cultist_000_1.text: You seek out this holy place for idle chatter? Such foolishness.

Cultist_000_2.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Gydd
Cultist_000_2.text: The unworthy have been cast down, and our faith has been renewed.

Cultist_000_3.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Gydd
Cultist_000_3.text: This is a secret place. Do not speak of what you see, or we will find you.

Cultist_000_4.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Gydd
Cultist_000_4.text: I would not have chosen you for such blessings... yet the Dark Lady must not be questioned.

Cultist_000_5.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Gydd
Cultist_000_5.text: You never did have sense, did you.

Cultist_000_6.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Gydd
Cultist_000_6.text: I didn't believe the rumours, yet it's true, isn't it? She blessed you.

Cultist_000_7.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Gydd
Cultist_000_7.text: I look forward to serving you, my lady.

Cultist_000_8.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Gydd
Cultist_000_8.text: Praise Lady Shar, for delivering us a true leader.

SwayedJusticiar_1.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
SwayedJusticiar_1.text: We had to get rid of the Mother Superior - we had to cleanse ourselves in the eyes of Lady Shar.

SwayedJusticiar_2.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
SwayedJusticiar_2.text: Can you truly be the Dark Lady's chosen? It makes no sense...

SwayedJusticiar_3.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
SwayedJusticiar_3.text: You are a living mockery - I can only pray that you do not live long.

SwayedJusticiar_4.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
SwayedJusticiar_4.text: My faith in the Nightsinger is stronger than ever, thanks to you.

SwayedJusticiar_5.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
SwayedJusticiar_5.text: The Nightsinger favours you... but what of the Mother Superior?

SwayedJusticiar_6.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
SwayedJusticiar_6.text: I serve only you, my lady. I was amongst the very first to support you.

SwayedJusticiar_7.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
SwayedJusticiar_7.text: You wandered too far from the shadows. Now you are beyond saving.

SwayedJusticiar_8.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
SwayedJusticiar_8.text: We have little cause to talk. Leave me be.

AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_002_0.speaker: Sharran Novice Monteith
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_002_0.text: What will come now, I wonder?
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_002_0.context: NodeContext: Speculating to self in the aftermath of a succesful coup launched against the Shar cult's former leader, Viconia.

AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_002_1.speaker: Sharran Novice Monteith
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_002_1.text: Change will be unusual. This place has only ever known Mother Superior Viconia as leader...
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_002_1.context: NodeContext: Speculating to self in the aftermath of a succesful coup launched against the Shar cult's former leader, Viconia.

AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_002_2.speaker: Sharran Novice Monteith
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_002_2.text: I chose the winning side. All will be well, I am sure.
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_002_2.context: NodeContext: Speculating to self in the aftermath of a succesful coup launched against the Shar cult's former leader, Viconia.

AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_002_3.speaker: Sharran Novice Monteith
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_002_3.text: ...though, the title of Mother Superior has slipped from her grasp.
AD_Interim_SharranTrainee_002_3.context: NodeContext: Speculating to self in the aftermath of a succesful coup launched against the Shar cult's former leader, Viconia.

PAD_JusticiarHelmet_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_JusticiarHelmet_0.text: A Dark Justiciar helm. I wanted one of my own so badly... and the Mother Superior would always deny me.
PAD_JusticiarHelmet_0.context: NodeContext: Shar path - Wistful/old childhood longing

PAD_JusticiarHelmet_1.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_JusticiarHelmet_1.text: A Dark Justiciar helm. I wanted one of my own so badly... hard to imagine, now.
PAD_JusticiarHelmet_1.context: NodeContext: Anti-Shar path - Old childhood longing, now an object of revulsion.

LeftCheckpoint_Primary_0.speaker: Sharran Sentry Hendly
LeftCheckpoint_Primary_0.text: No farther, or you'll find yourself sporting a new hole in your torso.
LeftCheckpoint_Primary_0.context: NodeContext: Warning to a potential trespasser

AD_SharVoiceAltar_0.speaker: GROUP_SHA_VoiceOfShar
AD_SharVoiceAltar_0.text: My Chosen, your final trial awaits. Enter the Chamber of Loss.

PAD_PostViconia_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_PostViconia_0.text: I have to find my parents. They must be close.
PAD_PostViconia_0.context: NodeContext: Urgent. SH has rejected her goddess and just defeated her old leader. Now she's looking for her parents.

PAD_PostViconia_1.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_PostViconia_1.text: My final task lies ahead, in the Chamber of Loss.
PAD_PostViconia_1.context: NodeContext: Purposeful. SH is on a holy mission bestowed by her goddess. She has just defeated her former leader, and now the final step awaits, so that she can become Shar's chosen.

PAD_SpottedCaveHole_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SpottedCaveHole_0.text: There's a hole back there, behind the crates.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_35.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_35.text: You and I need to speak...

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_32.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_32.text: Unless, of course, you are intent on attacking me again? I would not advise it.
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_32.context: NodeContext: Cautioning - referring to how the player attacked an illusion of her earlier.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_42.speaker: Jaheira
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_42.text: You've finally found yourself a following, Mother Superior. And you only had to hollow out their heads to do it.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_140.speaker: Minsc
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_140.text: Pin your eyes to the treacherous she-drow. Do not focus on the many, many others - Boo will handle them.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_114.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_114.text: Always a pleasure to see old acquaintances. But you would be wise to not interfere in this matter.
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_114.context: NodeContext: A little bittersweet, before hardening into a warning. Addressed to Minsc and/or Jaheira (old companions of hers from earlier games, shocked to see her again).

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_111.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_111.text: We already spoke - while you tried to poke about in my thoughts.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_8.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_8.text: We already spoke - if you can call that 'Mapping' farce a conversation.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_88.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_88.text: A necessary ruse - one that allowed me to seek out your true intentions. The House of Grief attracts all manner of people, but only some have value to Lady Shar.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_63.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_63.text: You have value. Quite an adventure has brought you to this point - illithids, kidnapping, infection, the Hells, hunted by cultists and githyanki alike... and of course, the artefact.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_87.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_87.text: It's called an Astral Prism. And let me guess - you want it. An old song, take my word for it.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_102.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_102.text: Its name does not concern me. Its power does. I have been awaiting word of this item for some time, ever since I dispatched a cadre of Lady Shar's children to retrieve it. I have been very patient, but no more.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_0.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_0.text: I felt Shadowheart's presence in your mind, and with it, the artefact. She succeeded in retrieving it, but then it is you who appeared, not her. Where is the artefact?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_95.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_95.text: Why do you even want it?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_129.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_129.text: I did not consent to questions. But I suppose you have undergone a great deal to reach this place, and anything I tell you cannot compromise me now - for you will either leave on my terms, or not at all...

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_43.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_43.text: Whispers reached my ears from all corners - potential rivals of Lady Shar, all vying for the same prize. A new god, amassing the disaffected, the outcasts - those who should turn to us.
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_43.context: NodeContext: Note of anger at the end - the Absolute is encrouching on her goddess's territory

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_69.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_69.text: This 'Absolute' is but an upstart; disturbing the natural order and threatening to impede the glorious return of Lady Shar's pure, endless darkness.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_77.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_77.text: I had to act. I had to strangle that foul conspiracy while it was still in the cradle.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_21.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_21.text: We learned all we could - the artefact was the one thing the Absolutists feared. The one thing they desperately wanted to keep out of their enemies' grasp. I had to have it.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_76.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_76.text: Shar bid you to do all of this?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_58.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_58.text: Lady Shar's concerns lie elsewhere - with another. But she is a goddess... she can afford to ignore that which does not threaten her.
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_58.context: NodeContext: Hint of tension between her and her goddess. Their goals aren't aligned

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_155.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_155.text: I must keep her faith alive in mortal hearts. I must defend her ways, lead her children, stop all threats. Even if I must go against her wishes, I will prove myself her most loyal servant.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_92.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_92.text: You thought you could best the Absolute? The githyanki?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_50.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_50.text: To fight so many foes openly could prove unwise. Shar's children are better deployed as daggers in the shadows, not massed upon a battlefield.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_49.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_49.text: So let the others fight, while we wait. Once they are spent and bloodied from each other, we would slip in and take the prize. Alas, most of those I sent, perished. All but one - Shadowheart.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_10.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_10.text: *Viconia trails off, holding your gaze with a dark, hungry look. She has staked everything on acquiring the Astral Prism.*

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_153.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_153.text: Then answer me - where is the artefact?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_37.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_37.text: The Astral Prism is with me. And it's staying with me.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_23.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_23.text: A bold claim given your current circumstances. I have not assembled my forces here just to spectate.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_20.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_20.text: Somehow I'm not sure I should tell you.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_22.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_22.text: Then this will be a very short conversation. I have not assembled my forces here just to spectate.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_5.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_5.text: Long gone. That thing was more trouble than it was worth.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_7.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_7.text: No, I think not. The artefact occupies you greatly, I felt it. Most curiously as well - like you hate it and need it. Millstone and life preserver.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_70.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_70.text: Humour me with a little negotiation. Perhaps we can find terms that will allow blades to remain sheathed.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_147.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_147.text: All right, you wish to negotiate? Make me an offer then.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_16.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_16.text: How about the artefact for your life? And perhaps even my support in the battles yet to come, against the Absolute?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_148.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_148.text: This must be truly important, if Shar would allow you to make such an offer. Why do you want it?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_146.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_146.text: Shar will allow you to make such an offer?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_115.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_115.text: My Lady ... she does not heed this new threat. This Absolute.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_30.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_30.text: Perhaps she is above such mortal concerns, but I must preserve her church, even if she does not ask me to.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_14.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_14.text: When I deal with the Absolute, my standing with Lady Shar will be stronger than ever. My rightful place is at her right hand, and I will remain there.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_89.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_89.text: I will not be replaced by Shadow...

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_71.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_71.text: *You suddenly realise what has been troubling her. Shar has rewarded her loyalty by forcing her to groom her own replacement - Shadowheart.*

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_72.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_72.text: I can't give you the artefact. But I can give you Shadowheart.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_59.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_59.text: I shall find her in due time. Perhaps I'll disguise myself, and ask your corpse where she's hiding.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_126.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_126.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_78.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_78.text: Not happening. Even if I wanted to give it to you, I can't. The artefact is bound to me. It will kill you.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_90.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_90.text: My interest is defeating the Absolute. It seems you're on that path already. I will not have it said that I am unreasonable.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_15.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_15.text: Shadowheart. Surrender her to me - she has much to answer for.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_25.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_25.text: Let me go, and I'll bring her to you.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_66.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_66.text: Tsk'va. You would trade out a proven ally for the empty promises of Shar's despotic disciple?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_1.speaker: Jaheira
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_1.text: I imagine she will have something to say about the matter. If we must return, let it be with blades bared.
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_1.context: NodeContext: Snort of contempt for Viconia, and for us if we plan on giving Shadowheart to her.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_45.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_45.text: Go, fetch her. And should you not stay true to your word... well...

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_38.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_38.text: The child Shadowheart can be irritating and naive, but what do you hope to gain by handing her to DeVir?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_57.speaker: Karlach
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_57.text: This better be a long con, soldier.
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_57.context: NodeContext: Aside, to the player, after the player has said to an enemy that they will betray Shadowheart.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_86.speaker: Wyll
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_86.text: You are truly out of your mind, to even consider the notion. Shadowheart is our ally - our friend.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_106.speaker: Gale
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_106.text: Shadowheart is one of us. Betray her, and you betray us all.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_116.speaker: Astarion
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_116.text: Sure, fine - whatever we have to say to escape this woman.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_137.speaker: Minsc
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_137.text: We will? My friend, has it escaped your notice that Viconia is not good...?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_143.speaker: Halsin
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_143.text: A ruse, surely? You cannot actually intend to betray Shadowheart, after all you have been through... can you?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_52.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_52.text: What will you do to her?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_121.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_121.text: She will be reeducated. Lady Shar may still have use for her - under my control.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_67.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_67.text: Reeducation. Viconia would feed Shadowheart a doctrine of lies before she could see the plain truth.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_9.speaker: Jaheira
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_9.text: What can a worm teach others but how to crawl? Shadowheart has no need of your 'instruction', Viconia.
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_9.context: NodeContext: Contempt for Viconia and whatever lessons she proposes to teach.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_29.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_29.text: These Sharrans erase the personality of all those who threaten them. Just another miserable cult.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_64.speaker: Karlach
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_64.text: I think we both know exactly what she means by that. Our girl would be gone.
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_64.context: NodeContext: To the player, after a bad guy has said SH will be 'reeducated' if brought to the Sharran cloister. Foreboding, not willing to give up SH.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_93.speaker: Wyll
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_93.text: 'Reeducation?' Forced indoctrination, more like - her memories cleansed, her mind a clean parchment for Viconia to write on.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_107.speaker: Gale
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_107.text: Do not insult our intelligence. You'd erase her, make a blank vellum of her mind, her memories, and inscribe it with your poison.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_110.speaker: Astarion
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_110.text: 'Reeducation' sounds an awful lot like enslavement to me.
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_110.context: NodeContext: Astarion's not impressed, given his own history

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_125.speaker: Minsc
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_125.text: Shadowheart has no need for any of Viconia's educating. She is sinister enough by herself - and our ally all the same.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_139.speaker: Halsin
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_139.text: Reeducation. As if this sect has not mangled poor Shadowheart's mind enough already.
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_139.context: NodeContext: grim. imagining what torments will await a companion if betrayed

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_105.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_105.text: Oh, but I shall. I'll just ask your corpse where she's hiding.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_113.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_113.text: She was mine to deal with - you robbed me of that.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_65.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_65.text: I suppose dealing with you will have to suffice.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_91.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_91.text: Killing me will achieve nothing. There's a greater threat to face together - the Absolute.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_2.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_2.text: Perhaps... perhaps I am being ungrateful. You spared me having to look upon that whelp Shadowheart's face again.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_133.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_133.text: Very well. You may go freely, and count upon Lady Shar's warriors when the final battle is met.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_151.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_151.text: The artefact alone can't save you. Best if we unite against our common enemy - the Absolute.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_103.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_103.text: The Absolute shall be dealt with in time. You shall be dealt with right now.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_127.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_127.text: As far as the artefact is concerned, there's nothing to discuss.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_130.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_130.text: Reconsider. Aid me, and you can count on my support against the Absolute. Reject me, and your journey ends here.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_123.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_123.text: Too late to keep your counsel, I'm afraid. You already revealed so much to me during the Mapping.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_80.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_80.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_154.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_154.text: Oh but I think you do - the Mapping unearthed much more than your heartform - I saw all your secrets.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_98.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_98.text: I know I have value to my patron - but what you see in me I've no idea.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_85.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_85.text: Please, do you truly think that is an option?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_84.speaker: Player
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_84.text: With such an audience? A trap, if I ever saw one.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_83.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_83.text: A trap? Perhaps. But not all traps need to be sprung. Sometimes it's wiser to await an even greater prey.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_4.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_4.text: Welcome to the true heart of the House of Grief. For what is grief but a facet of loss? And what is loss but the very nature of my Lady Shar's power?

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_55.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_55.text: I saw in your mind, when we spoke above. Quite an adventure has brought you to this point - illithids, kidnapping, infection, the Hells, hunted by cultists and githyanki alike... and of course, the artefact.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_40.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_40.text: Remember our agreement - deliver Shadowheart to me, and you can count upon Lady Shar's warriors at your side, when the time comes.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_152.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_152.text: You may have evaded the Mapping of the Heart, but never mind - I can delve into your true intentions right now...

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_122.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_122.text: *You feel the barest of presences caress your mind - she's reading your thoughts.*

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_47.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_47.text: Ah, as I thought. Quite an adventure has brought you to this point - illithids, kidnapping, infection, the Hells, hunted by cultists and githyanki alike... and of course, the artefact.

ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_142.speaker: Viconia DeVir
ConfrontViconia_NoShadowheart_142.text: Linger if you wish, but there is little else to be said until the Absolute's armies launch their final assault. We shall be ready.

PAD_TortureRack_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TortureRack_0.text: I... I think I was taught to break peoples' thumbs here. I swear I can remember the snap of bone, the screams...
PAD_TortureRack_0.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH has turned from Shar. Shudder of horror at a fragmented memory of her shar training

PAD_TortureRack_6.speaker: Player
PAD_TortureRack_6.text: But that did help me free Liam, back in the goblins' camp. Silver lining, I suppose...
PAD_TortureRack_6.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH has turned from Shar. Thoughtful (much earlier, she freed a captive man from his shackles  by breaking his thumbs)

PAD_TortureRack_1.speaker: Player
PAD_TortureRack_1.text: How many people did I help break upon this thing...?
PAD_TortureRack_1.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH has turned from Shar. Shudder of horror at a fragmented memory of her shar training

PAD_TortureRack_2.speaker: Player
PAD_TortureRack_2.text: I remember this, I'm sure... a true workhorse in turning people to Lady Shar. They'd beg for her embrace.

PAD_TortureRack_3.speaker: Player
PAD_TortureRack_3.text: A grim-looking piece. I'll bet it's responsible for more than a few howls and screams.

PAD_TortureRack_5.speaker: Player
PAD_TortureRack_5.text: I think I remember... breaking thumbs? Yes, the Mother Superior showed me.
PAD_TortureRack_5.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH is loyal to Shar. Recalling her torture training

PAD_TortureRack_4.speaker: Player
PAD_TortureRack_4.text: I suppose that's how I knew how to free Liam, back in the goblins' camp. Lucky for him.
PAD_TortureRack_4.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH is loyal to Shar. Amused by an ironic realisation.much earlier, she freed a captive man from his shackles  by breaking his thumbs)

AD_SwearFealty_SharranTrainee_002_0.speaker: Sharran Novice Monteith
AD_SwearFealty_SharranTrainee_002_0.text: Lady Shar has blessed us with a new leader. I live to serve.
AD_SwearFealty_SharranTrainee_002_0.context: NodeContext: Fervent declaration of loyalty. 'All hail the queen'

Trainee_004_0.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
Trainee_004_0.text: Many seek the Dark Lady's embrace, but few have what it truly takes.

Trainee_004_2.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
Trainee_004_2.text: Caution, sister. You may be blessed, but there can be only one leader here.

Trainee_004_3.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
Trainee_004_3.text: You are our guide now, my lady. Lead us to the Nightsinger's embrace.

Trainee_004_4.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
Trainee_004_4.text: The Mother Superior lost her way. She sealed her own fate.

Trainee_004_5.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
Trainee_004_5.text: What was her presence like? Did you hear her voice? Feel her touch. It must have been... overwhelming.

Trainee_004_6.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
Trainee_004_6.text: My heart, my mind, my blade. All are yours, my lady.

Trainee_004_7.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
Trainee_004_7.text: In the darkness, the old become young, the ugly become beautiful, and sins become virtues. Who would not wish for that?

PAD_DefeatedParent_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DefeatedParent_0.context: NodeContext: Angry, hostile (player killed her parents)

PAD_DefeatedParent_1.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DefeatedParent_1.text: They were mine to deal with - not yours!
PAD_DefeatedParent_1.context: NodeContext: Angry, hostile. Player killed two prisoners that she was destined  to sacrifce

OptionalCultist_001_0.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Uttermask
OptionalCultist_001_0.text: Are you here to be saved, or sacrificed? Both can be arranged.

OptionalCultist_001_1.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Uttermask
OptionalCultist_001_1.text: Lady Shar has blessed us with a leader of her own choosing. We are honoured beyond measure.

OptionalCultist_001_2.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Uttermask
OptionalCultist_001_2.text: Lady Shar grant you mercy - because I know the Mother Superior won't.

OptionalCultist_001_3.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Uttermask
OptionalCultist_001_3.text: To think so many sleep through the night. They are blind to true beauty.

OptionalCultist_001_4.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Uttermask
OptionalCultist_001_4.text: My heart, my mind, my blade. All are yours, Lady Shadowheart.

OptionalCultist_001_5.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Uttermask
OptionalCultist_001_5.text: So many of us have served the Dark Lady well, for years. Yet you are blessed? Disgraceful.

OptionalCultist_001_7.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Uttermask
OptionalCultist_001_7.text: Rejoice - Lady Shar's ranks have been cleansed.

OptionalCultist_001_8.speaker: Sharran Fidelian Uttermask
OptionalCultist_001_8.text: I don't believe it. Lady Shar would never bless the likes of you. Some charlatan's trick, no doubt.

PAD_WyvernWhiskey_0.speaker: Player
PAD_WyvernWhiskey_0.text: That label... I actually remember it. Wyvern Whiskey. Mother Superior's favourite. Reminded her of Waterdeep, she said.

PAD_WyvernWhiskey_2.speaker: Player
PAD_WyvernWhiskey_2.text: Wyvern Whiskey, from Nimbral. Only the guild in Waterdeep imports this, I believe...

PAD_QueenJewels_0.speaker: Player
PAD_QueenJewels_0.text: Mother Superior's jewels - a gift from the queen of Suldanessellar... I suppose they're mine now.
PAD_QueenJewels_0.context: NodeContext: Sull-duh-ness-seh-llar (name of an elven city). 'to the victor, the spoils'

PAD_QueenJewels_3.speaker: Player
PAD_QueenJewels_3.text: Curious. I could never quite tell if she was proud of them or not.
PAD_QueenJewels_3.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful - 'how well did I really know her?'

PAD_QueenJewels_1.speaker: Player
PAD_QueenJewels_1.text: Interesting jewellery. Certainly not from around here.

PAD_QueenJewels_2.speaker: Player
PAD_QueenJewels_2.text: These jewels... why do I remember these, of all things? A gift from Suldanessellar, Mother Superior said.
PAD_QueenJewels_2.context: NodeContext: Sull-duh-ness-seh-llar (name of an elven city).

PAD_QueenJewels_4.speaker: Player
PAD_QueenJewels_4.text: Elf jewellery. Royal jewellery in fact, from Suldanessellar, I believe. A curious find.
PAD_QueenJewels_4.context: NodeContext: Sull-duh-ness-seh-llar (name of an elven city). Intrigued.

PAD_Mannequin_GreenDress_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Mannequin_GreenDress_0.text: I don't think I ever wore this one. Shame - the colour might have suited me.
PAD_Mannequin_GreenDress_0.context: NodeContext: Examining a dress on a mannequin, part of the Sharrans collection of disguises. This one doesn't stir any memories.

PAD_FoundGith_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundGith_0.text: A githyanki. Head removed. They tortured her for information, then made sure the corpse couldn't help anyone else...

Dead_Viconia_24.speaker: Narrator
Dead_Viconia_24.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_Viconia_18.speaker: Player
Dead_Viconia_18.text: How did you come to be here?

Dead_Viconia_25.speaker: Viconia DeVir
Dead_Viconia_25.text: Lady Shar's command... Waterdeep, deception... slaughter...

Dead_Viconia_19.speaker: Player
Dead_Viconia_19.text: How do I enter the Chamber of Loss?

Dead_Viconia_1.speaker: Player
Dead_Viconia_1.text: How do I enter the Chamber of Loss?

Dead_Viconia_5.speaker: Player
Dead_Viconia_5.text: Why did you do all of this to me?

Dead_Viconia_29.speaker: Narrator
Dead_Viconia_29.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Dead_Viconia_31.speaker: Narrator
Dead_Viconia_31.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

AD_Interim_SwayedDarkJusticiar_0.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_Interim_SwayedDarkJusticiar_0.text: We did well. Lady Shar will smile upon us.
AD_Interim_SwayedDarkJusticiar_0.context: NodeContext: Proud. Speaking out loud to anyone who cares to listen in the aftermath of a successful coup against the (now former) leader of the sharran cult. This character was one of the first to change sides, and now feels vindicated/satisfied.

AD_Interim_SwayedDarkJusticiar_1.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_Interim_SwayedDarkJusticiar_1.text: I felt it in my very marrow - our future lies with Shadowheart.
AD_Interim_SwayedDarkJusticiar_1.context: NodeContext: Proud. Speaking out loud to anyone who cares to listen in the aftermath of a successful coup against the (now former) leader of the sharran cult. This character was one of the first to change sides, and now feels vindicated/satisfied.

AD_Interim_SwayedDarkJusticiar_2.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_Interim_SwayedDarkJusticiar_2.text: But now she is gone, and we remain. Lady Shar's bidding shall be done.
AD_Interim_SwayedDarkJusticiar_2.context: NodeContext: Proud. Speaking out loud to anyone who cares to listen in the aftermath of a successful coup against the (now former) leader of the sharran cult. This character was one of the first to change sides, and now feels vindicated/satisfied.

AD_Interim_SwayedDarkJusticiar_3.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Nightmist
AD_Interim_SwayedDarkJusticiar_3.text: The Mother Superior succumbed to her own ambitions. She strayed from Lady Shar's embrace.

ShadowheartFriend_4.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_4.text: Shadowheart - I mean, my lady. I'm sorry... that takes some getting used to.

ShadowheartFriend_7.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_7.text: This is not the time for talk.

ShadowheartFriend_13.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_13.text: At least we can talk freely, now that she is gone. What can I do for you?

ShadowheartFriend_23.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_23.text: I can still scarcely believe it. You've returned, and the Mother Superior is gone... So much can change, so quickly...

ShadowheartFriend_25.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_25.text: Shadowheart, good to see you again.

ShadowheartFriend_34.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_34.text: Shadowheart. Do you need supplies? Or just wanted to talk, perhaps?

ShadowheartFriend_44.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_44.text: My lady. How may I serve you?

ShadowheartFriend_55.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_55.text: Greetings. Do you seek to trade? As Shadowheart's friend, I'll extend the privilege to you as well.

ShadowheartFriend_27.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_27.text: Be sure to get everything you need. Come tomorrow, I'll be gone.

ShadowheartFriend_54.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFriend_54.text: Are you just going to remain here? There's no need - Viconia is gone.

ShadowheartFriend_21.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_21.text: Remains to be seen. This place is all I've ever known. In time, perhaps I'll venture out there, see what I've been missing. But for now... old habits die hard.

ShadowheartFriend_20.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFriend_20.text: No need for such formality - we're friends.

ShadowheartFriend_12.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_12.text: Please - don't call me 'friend'. You know what it's like here - backstabbing, vying for favour.

ShadowheartFriend_14.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_14.text: It could be dangerous for me, if others think I'm your favourite.

ShadowheartFriend_32.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFriend_32.text: There's much I still can't remember... Can you share anything with me? From when we were young?

ShadowheartFriend_45.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_45.text: Well... you had a pet mouse for a while. It was against the rules, of course. You used to hide him under your robes and feed him from your rations.

ShadowheartFriend_17.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_17.text: Nibbles. I suggested Brie, but you were having none of it.

ShadowheartFriend_6.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_6.text: She caught you with him. Forced you to get rid of him... in front of everyone to make an example.

ShadowheartFriend_36.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_36.text: You always loved animals, but you never let yourself get too close after that.

ShadowheartFriend_39.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_39.text: I'm sorry. Not the sort of thing you want to hear, I'm sure.

ShadowheartFriend_0.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_0.text: She caught you with Nibbles - that was his name. Forced you to get rid of him... in front of everyone as an example. You always loved animals, but you never let yourself get too close after that.

ShadowheartFriend_11.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFriend_11.text: I don't suppose there are any pleasant memories you could share?

ShadowheartFriend_69.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_69.text: Well... you know that little scar on your elbow?

ShadowheartFriend_56.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFriend_56.text: You know about that? It's barely the size of a pea.

ShadowheartFriend_8.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFriend_8.text: Yes. I had been wondering about that.

ShadowheartFriend_48.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_48.text: I was there when you picked that up - it was years ago, when we were initiates. Some of the others were intent on tormenting us... until you showed them the error of their ways.

ShadowheartFriend_9.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_9.text: I think it was six against two, and most of them were bigger than us, to boot. But you saw them off, all of them.

ShadowheartFriend_42.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_42.text: There were some bruised lips and black eyes in the mess hall that night. From then on, they left us alone. Or at least, they bothered us less.

ShadowheartFriend_10.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_10.text: A collision between your elbow and the teeth of a girl called Buddug - she came away from it worse than you.

ShadowheartFriend_59.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_59.text: She was on the same mission as you. I suppose she won't be coming back...

ShadowheartFriend_30.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_30.text: In any case, the Mother Superior soon broke up the fighting, though she didn't punish us. In fact, I saw her smiling - I think she was proud of you.

ShadowheartFriend_1.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_1.text: Not at all - if anything, they seemed pleased your training was paying off.

ShadowheartFriend_2.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_2.text: I never saw the Mother Superior smile very often, but she did then. I think she was proud of you.

ShadowheartFriend_31.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_31.text: As for the scar, that was from a collision between your elbow and the teeth of a girl called Buddug. She was on the same mission as you. I suppose she won't be coming back...

ShadowheartFriend_19.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_19.text: Just small things, silly things... the sort you'd scarcely recall even if your memories were left intact.

ShadowheartFriend_52.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_52.text: You had a little hiding place that you went to when you needed to get away - you brought me there sometimes. We'd talk, play, read, do each other's hair...

ShadowheartFriend_40.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFriend_40.text: I think I found the place you mean - behind a storage area.

ShadowheartFriend_22.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_22.text: You'd be the first. As quartermaster, I was able to keep it hidden back there, exactly as you left it.

ShadowheartFriend_60.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFriend_60.text: A hiding place? Where is it?

ShadowheartFriend_16.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_16.text: Hidden at the back of the storage area. Luckily enough, as quartermaster, I was able to keep it hidden back there. It should be, well, if not how you remember it, exactly as you left it.

ShadowheartFriend_43.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFriend_43.text: So, my hair... that was you?

ShadowheartFriend_24.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_24.text: The plait and fringe? Yes - on your instructions, of course. You were very intent on a bold look, I think you said. My hands were cramped by the time I finished, but you were very pleased.

ShadowheartFriend_47.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_47.text: I like the new look as well, though. You always did like a dramatic touch.
ShadowheartFriend_47.context: NodeContext: Playful/smiling (SH's hair changed after she rejected her goddess)

ShadowheartFriend_63.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFriend_63.text: You mentioned I had a hideout in here somewhere - where?

ShadowheartFriend_15.speaker: Player
ShadowheartFriend_15.text: From what you said before, you're the one responsible for my hair?

ShadowheartFriend_61.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_61.text: Shadowheart. Do you need supplies? Or just wanted to talk, perhaps?

ShadowheartFriend_67.speaker: Nocturne
ShadowheartFriend_67.text: Shadowheart. Do you need supplies? Or just wanted to talk, perhaps?

AD_Interim_ViconiaCultist_001_0.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Owltalon
AD_Interim_ViconiaCultist_001_0.text: The Mother Superior is gone... I can only hope for mercy.
AD_Interim_ViconiaCultist_001_0.context: NodeContext: Speaking to self/no one in particular, unpacking recent events. (There was a coup against the Shar cult's leadership - this cultist was a loyalist but survived the conflict that ensued)

AD_Interim_ViconiaCultist_001_1.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Owltalon
AD_Interim_ViconiaCultist_001_1.text: I never would have imagined her losing control of this place.
AD_Interim_ViconiaCultist_001_1.context: NodeContext: Speaking to self/no one in particular, unpacking recent events. (There was a coup against the Shar cult's leadership - this cultist was a loyalist but survived the conflict that ensued)

AD_Interim_ViconiaCultist_001_2.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Owltalon
AD_Interim_ViconiaCultist_001_2.text: This is Lady Shar's will. It must be.
AD_Interim_ViconiaCultist_001_2.context: NodeContext: Speaking to self/no one in particular, unpacking recent events. (There was a coup against the Shar cult's leadership - this cultist was a loyalist but survived the conflict that ensued)

AD_Interim_ViconiaCultist_001_3.speaker: Justiciar Crusader Owltalon
AD_Interim_ViconiaCultist_001_3.text: No matter, I can be loyal to the new leadership now, if allowed.
AD_Interim_ViconiaCultist_001_3.context: NodeContext: Speaking to self/no one in particular, unpacking recent events. (There was a coup against the Shar cult's leadership - this cultist was a loyalist but survived the conflict that ensued)

GrottoSentry_0.speaker: Sentry Fredrichk
GrottoSentry_0.text: The Mother Superior will deal with you.

GrottoSentry_1.speaker: Sentry Fredrichk
GrottoSentry_1.text: Greetings, my lady. Come and go as you wish.

GrottoSentry_2.speaker: Sentry Fredrichk
GrottoSentry_2.text: We don't need any more trouble. Not after what happened to the Mother Superior.

Trainee_000_0.speaker: Sharran Novice Dohna
Trainee_000_0.text: Many seek the Dark Lady's embrace, but few have what it truly takes.

Trainee_000_1.speaker: Sharran Novice Dohna
Trainee_000_1.text: At least you had the nerve to come back and face your reckoning - I'll give you that.

Trainee_000_2.speaker: Sharran Novice Dohna
Trainee_000_2.text: The Nightsinger will clothe us in black satin, and lead us to paradise within the extinguished sun.

Trainee_000_3.speaker: Sharran Novice Dohna
Trainee_000_3.text: This place has known no leader but the Mother Superior. Change will be... curious.

Trainee_000_4.speaker: Sharran Novice Dohna
Trainee_000_4.text: I heard about you... but you're different to how they described you. Are you truly favoured by Lady Shar?

Trainee_000_5.speaker: Sharran Novice Dohna
Trainee_000_5.text: Why would you turn from Lady Shar? Why turn from the inevitable?

Trainee_000_6.speaker: Sharran Novice Dohna
Trainee_000_6.text: You should see the Mother Superior. There is little to be said until she has judged you.

Trainee_000_7.speaker: Sharran Novice Dohna
Trainee_000_7.text: Remember my face, my lady. I shall win a place at your side, in the wars to come.

Trainee_000_8.speaker: Sharran Novice Dohna
Trainee_000_8.text: May your reign be dark and glorious.

Trainee_003_1.speaker: Sharran Novice Bluenail
Trainee_003_1.text: This is Lady Shar's holy place. Show respect.

Trainee_003_2.speaker: Sharran Novice Bluenail
Trainee_003_2.text: With your blessing, my blade will be most keen, my lady.

Trainee_003_4.speaker: Sharran Novice Bluenail
Trainee_003_4.text: I can scarcely believe it - I remember besting you in training, yet you have been blessed by the Nightsinger...?

Trainee_003_5.speaker: Sharran Novice Bluenail
Trainee_003_5.text: Spare me. There's no words you can utter that can dig you out of this mess.

Trainee_003_6.speaker: Sharran Novice Bluenail
Trainee_003_6.text: I turned to Lady Shar after I lost my family. She gave me a new one. A better one.

Trainee_003_7.speaker: Sharran Novice Bluenail
Trainee_003_7.text: All will be consumed by Lady Shar's darkness in the end. Even the Mother Superior.

Trainee_003_8.speaker: Sharran Novice Bluenail
Trainee_003_8.text: Shadowheart. I see you've changed your hair - praise Lady Shar.

Cultist_002_0.speaker: Sharran Novice Greymask
Cultist_002_0.text: I can't believe it. Is that truly you, Shadowheart? I thought you'd be the very first to die on the Mother Superior's mission - not the only one to return.

Cultist_002_1.speaker: Sharran Novice Greymask
Cultist_002_1.text: To think, we found you, raised you... and this is how you repay us?

Cultist_002_2.speaker: Sharran Novice Greymask
Cultist_002_2.text: What must you have done to win the Dark Lady's esteem? I cannot imagine it was prowess, or cunning.

Cultist_002_3.speaker: Sharran Novice Greymask
Cultist_002_3.text: I will create a hundred Selûnite widows in your honour, my lady.

Cultist_002_4.speaker: Sharran Novice Greymask
Cultist_002_4.text: Show respect, or we shall show you steel.

Cultist_002_5.speaker: Sharran Novice Greymask
Cultist_002_5.text: Under your stewardship, we shall truly flourish.

Cultist_002_6.speaker: Sharran Novice Greymask
Cultist_002_6.text: You should have stayed missing, moon-bitch.

Cultist_002_7.speaker: Sharran Novice Greymask
Cultist_002_7.text: The Mother Superior is vanquished... I can scarcely believe it.

Cultist_002_8.speaker: Sharran Novice Greymask
Cultist_002_8.text: Commit yourself to our teachings. Perhaps you too can be embraced.

AD_OnTurn_GrottoCheckpointGuard_000_1.speaker: Sharran Sentry Imwise
AD_OnTurn_GrottoCheckpointGuard_000_1.text: You cannot withstand the Nightsinger's power!

MemoryMirror_13.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_13.text: *The huge mirror stares down at you like a great, dark eye.*

MemoryMirror_81.speaker: Shadowheart
MemoryMirror_81.text: This feels familiar to me, somehow. I'm sure I've stood before this mirror before... many times, perhaps.
MemoryMirror_81.context: NodeContext: Unsettled sense of recognition/hairs standing on the back of your neck. (this mirror is what was used to take Shadowheart's memories from her)

MemoryMirror_2.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_2.text: Gaze into the mirror, intent on offering it one of your memories.

MemoryMirror_6.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_6.text: *Your mind still reels from what you have already received from the mirror. You cannot partake again.*

MemoryMirror_59.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_59.text: *You feel your goddess' presence once again. As her Chosen, you have already made the ultimate offering.*

MemoryMirror_21.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_21.text: *Now, all you need to do is claim a reward.*

MemoryMirror_105.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_105.text: *With so much of your mind already surrendered to the mirror, you have nothing to offer. A sorry outcome.*

MemoryMirror_94.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_94.text: *The mirror has already leached away all it desires from you. Your mind is but an empty cup.*

MemoryMirror_80.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_80.text: *The mirror's emptiness seems to draw your into a stupefying embrace. Your thoughts, feelings, memories - they grow slow and drowsy, drifting away from each other.*

MemoryMirror_109.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_109.text: *You must surrender some part of yourself. But what?*

MemoryMirror_47.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_47.text: Part with the forbidden knowledge from the Thayan Tome.

MemoryMirror_98.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_98.text: Offer memories of your strength - times when you triumphed, thanks to your raw power.

MemoryMirror_46.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_46.text: Give up memories of your youth, when your heart was carefree and your limbs were nimble.

MemoryMirror_45.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_45.text: Relinquish memories of fortitude and well-being, when body and mind held fast against all challenges.

MemoryMirror_116.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_116.text: Surrender valued knowledge gleaned from books, scrolls, tablets... words that left a mark on your mind - but no more.

MemoryMirror_101.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_101.text: Let go of some wisdoms that time has bestowed upon you - old wounds, tough lessons, and fond memories alike.

MemoryMirror_33.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_33.text: Give away memories of when your charm stood to you - the applause of the swayed, the smiles of the beguiled, the kisses of the seduced.

MemoryMirror_112.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_112.text: Rediscovering your long-lost friend bolstered your very being - surrender that feeling.

MemoryMirror_95.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_95.text: Part with memories of blooming romance, when your heart was full and smile came readily.

MemoryMirror_44.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_44.text: You learned much from Allister Marnley, your old teacher. Now part with his lessons.

MemoryMirror_18.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_18.text: *Something precious was surrendered. Already, you cannot recall its exact nature - but you feel its loss, all the same.*

MemoryMirror_30.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_30.text: *You feel parts of your own being take flight from you. Is this what Shadowheart experienced, when she surrendered her memories...?*

MemoryMirror_4.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_4.text: *The gaps in your mind grow wider as you allow yourself to be diminished.*

MemoryMirror_100.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_100.text: *Still though, for whatever was lost, something new shall be gained...*

MemoryMirror_73.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_73.text: *You feel the presence of something, ancient and unknowable. It has taken notice of you.*

MemoryMirror_38.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_38.text: *The spilled blood of Selûne's daughter comes to your mind. You are a favoured servant. A Dark Justiciar.*

MemoryMirror_87.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_87.text: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your craven heart.*

MemoryMirror_85.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_85.text: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your false heart.*

MemoryMirror_14.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_14.text: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your jealous heart.*

MemoryMirror_43.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_43.text: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your prying heart.*

MemoryMirror_27.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_27.text: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your yearning heart.*

MemoryMirror_9.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_9.text: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your violent heart.*

MemoryMirror_55.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_55.text: *Where once the mirror showed nothing, there is now something. Memories, experiences, skills - your own. Surrendered once, and now offered back to you to choose from.*

MemoryMirror_102.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_102.text: Claim the strength found in a spirit who has had to fight for her place in the world.

MemoryMirror_75.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_75.text: *Day after day, the bullies would await you. But you would not give in. Whatever they did, you would return in kind, blow for blow. Your knuckles ached. Your lip bled. But you stood tall.*

MemoryMirror_36.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_36.text: Steal the deft-handed prowess of someone trained in stealth all her life.

MemoryMirror_67.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_67.text: *First you took apples from stalls, then gold from purses. Once, you even lifted a necklace right off a matron's throat. The other novices were in awe of you.*

MemoryMirror_17.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_17.text: Seize the fortitude that lies in a heart denied a thousand times.

MemoryMirror_53.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_53.text: *The Mother Superior shook her head. You were not yet ready. But you would persist. You would try harder. One day, you would become a Dark Justiciar.*

MemoryMirror_115.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_115.text: *The memory fades away, yet you feel its influence linger in your body.*

MemoryMirror_32.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_32.text: Adopt the curiosity of a young child who hungered for knowledge forbidden to her.

MemoryMirror_7.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_7.text: *You devoured any book you could get your hands on, hungry for more. Sometimes you felt like you read the same thing over and over, yet the knowledge within always seemed new...*

MemoryMirror_60.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_60.text: *The memory fades away, yet it leaves its mark on your mind.*

MemoryMirror_106.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_106.text: *The dark mirror seems to turn dormant, its hunger sated.*

MemoryMirror_39.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_39.text: Absorb the wisdom of a novice who weathered harsh lessons and harsher punishments.

MemoryMirror_99.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_99.text: *The sting of the rod washes over you, again and again. Like some cruel, endless tide. But you shall not cry out, or let tears bead your eyes. You shall persevere.*

MemoryMirror_54.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_54.text: Embrace the cunning of a youth who learned to succeed through charm and deceit.

MemoryMirror_63.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_63.text: *A small miracle - the Mother Superior believed your lie. Or does she...? There is a bright gleam in her eye. Appreciation, perhaps? Respect?*

MemoryMirror_28.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_28.text: *Where once the mirror showed nothing, there is now something. Memories, experiences, skills. All prised from the minds of others, and now offered to you, to choose from.*

MemoryMirror_88.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_88.text: Claim memories of strength from a long-dead general, who marched under the banner of a vanished kingdom.

MemoryMirror_64.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_64.text: *On either side, your ranks start to buckle under the enemy onslaught. You unleash a battle cry and push back, rallying the troops.*

MemoryMirror_72.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_72.text: Help yourself to the memories of a seasoned thief's most daring exploits.

MemoryMirror_79.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_79.text: *You escape across the rooftops of Baldur's Gate with the sure-footedness of a cat. The jingle of stolen gold and the fading cries of the City Watch are music to your ears.*

MemoryMirror_8.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_8.text: Seize the memories of a barbarian, whose mind and body were tempered against hardship.

MemoryMirror_5.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_5.text: *The cold bites, but you laugh and bare your chest. Be it blade, beast, or the elements - nothing daunts you.*

MemoryMirror_40.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_40.text: Glean the secrets of a wizard who once stalked the library of Candlekeep.

MemoryMirror_58.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_58.text: *Words and symbols flurry past. Years of reading by candlelight dulled your eyesight, but sharpened your mind. Your knowledge lights up even the murkiest of mysteries.*

MemoryMirror_93.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_93.text: Turn to the wisdom of a drow. Once of Lothe, then of Shar.

MemoryMirror_117.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_117.text: *Experience fills you - a lifetime in service of darkenss. Yet, most curious - there is light there also. Adventures, long past. Friends and companions, remembered with a secret fondness.*

MemoryMirror_0.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_0.text: Warm to the guile of a bard who could charm even a dragon.

MemoryMirror_29.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_29.text: *Adoring looks, fawning laughter and nods of agreement are your constant companions. Is there anything a quick tongue and a warm smile cannot achieve...?*

MemoryMirror_74.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_74.text: *It seems to be intrigued by you.*

MemoryMirror_56.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_56.text: *A foreign sensation assails you. For a moment, you do not feel like yourself.*

MemoryMirror_114.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_114.text: *Disappointment floods your mind. You were sure to succeed Stelmane, but Lord Enver Gortash has stolen your support. All that charming and cajoling in the parlours of the Upper City, wasted.*

MemoryMirror_34.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_34.text: *You embody Arves, the merchant you met, deep in mourning. His wife died, and he cannot bear to go on. Only the House of Grief can help him.*

MemoryMirror_70.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_70.text: *Whatever power lurks deeper in the recesses of the mirror has no interest in you.*

MemoryMirror_86.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_86.text: *You embody a merchant, deep in mourning. His wife died, and he cannot bear to go on. Only the House of Grief can help him.*

MemoryMirror_96.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_96.text: *You embody a heartbroken heiress, desperate to forget an unrequited love. The sadness flees from you... along with a string of numbers. A safe combination?*

MemoryMirror_92.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_92.text: *Your mind is that of corrupt alderman, eager to forget his transgressions. You feel them fade away... but your faith in the goddess Selûne is devoured along with them.*

MemoryMirror_37.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_37.text: *You embody an officer of the City Watch. A comrade died because of you. The dead man's face fades away... but the identities of informants vanish as well.*

MemoryMirror_83.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_83.text: *A jumble of memories clamour for your attention. They range from ancient to new. But none are yours.*

MemoryMirror_97.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_97.text: Your little hideaway in the cloister. It helped you weather life's blows. Give up that sense of solace.

MemoryMirror_84.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_84.text: You fled the city watch once, leaving graffiti in your wake. Let go of that memory of youthful speed and nimbleness.

MemoryMirror_104.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_104.text: You will not surrender any part of yourself. Invent a false offering to trick the mirror.

MemoryMirror_49.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_49.text: *To your surprise, the false memory is accepted. It fades from your mind as easily as it was conjured forth.*

MemoryMirror_23.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_23.text: *Your deception fails. You sense the mirror would snatch something true from you, but you have nothing it desires.*

MemoryMirror_11.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_11.text: *The deception fails. You feel that something true to you is wrested from you as punishment, with nothing given in return.*

MemoryMirror_62.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_62.text: Study the mirror. Try to grasp its true nature.

MemoryMirror_57.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_57.text: *A Mirror of Loss - a relic said to be as old as the Church of Shar itself. Those who stood before it could surrender their very thoughts and memories to the Lady of Loss.*

MemoryMirror_20.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_20.text: *Great powers rest within the realm of the mirror, to be granted at the Dark Lady's whim to those making a suitable offering - a piece of themselves.*

MemoryMirror_35.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_35.text: *Nothing comes to you. The mirror remains a mystery.*

MemoryMirror_76.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_76.text: An object of faith. Examine it closely. Try to understand its purpose.

MemoryMirror_91.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_91.text: Offer a prayer to the mirror.

MemoryMirror_68.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_68.text: Offer a prayer to the mirror.

MemoryMirror_111.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_111.text: Offer a prayer to the mirror.

MemoryMirror_3.speaker: Player
MemoryMirror_3.text: Offer a prayer to the mirror.

MemoryMirror_113.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_113.text: *You feel a presence; dark and ancient. It approves of your fealty.*

MemoryMirror_108.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_108.text: *Your prayers fade away into the nothingness of the mirror, unacknowledged.*

MemoryMirror_15.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_15.text: *A great, dark mirror looms over you, offering no reflection. You do not know its purpose... yet it feels oddly familiar to you, all the same.*

MemoryMirror_31.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_31.text: *A huge, polished disc looms before you. A mirror - one used by the Sharrans to plunder memories from the minds of others.*

MemoryMirror_51.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_51.text: *A huge, polished disc looms before you. A mirror - but one that offers no reflection. All you see in it is a void of endless darkness.*

MemoryMirror_77.speaker: Narrator
MemoryMirror_77.text: *A huge, polished disc looms before you. A mirror - one that was used to wrest your memories from you.*

PAD_FoundMirrorNote_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundMirrorNote_0.text: A mirror that steals memories? Very Sharran.

PAD_FoundMirrorNote_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundMirrorNote_1.text: So that mirror from before - it was used to steal memories.

ShadowheartMindWiped_4.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_4.text: Lady Shar's blessings be upon you.

ShadowheartMindWiped_16.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_16.text: I take it you're here at the Mother Superior's invitation - no outsider would have made it this far without permission.

ShadowheartMindWiped_12.speaker: Player
ShadowheartMindWiped_12.text: Shadowheart, it's me - [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. You know me.

ShadowheartMindWiped_42.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_42.text: I've never clapped eyes on you in my life. Did one of the others put you up to this? Tell you my name and see if you could get a rise out of me?

ShadowheartMindWiped_41.speaker: Player
ShadowheartMindWiped_41.text: I'm sorry. I did this to you.

ShadowheartMindWiped_0.speaker: Player
ShadowheartMindWiped_0.text: Seems like you're right where you're supposed to be.

ShadowheartMindWiped_8.speaker: Player
ShadowheartMindWiped_8.text: We journeyed together. Survived all sorts of perils.

ShadowheartMindWiped_19.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_19.text: Oh is that so? That's quite an imagination you have - are you a bard, granted entry to our Grotto in order to regale us with ballads and tall tales?
ShadowheartMindWiped_19.context: NodeContext: Amused/sceptical. Does not remember the player after a memory wipe.

ShadowheartMindWiped_9.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_9.text: Lovers? I think you must have me mistaken for someone with no taste.

ShadowheartMindWiped_1.speaker: Player
ShadowheartMindWiped_1.text: Show her a Night Orchid, to jog her memory.

ShadowheartMindWiped_39.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_39.text: Pretty, whatever it is. But if you're seeking to court me, I'm afraid I'm busy.

ShadowheartMindWiped_26.speaker: Player
ShadowheartMindWiped_26.text: They're your favourites. Don't you recognise them?

ShadowheartMindWiped_20.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_20.text: I don't have a favourite flower. Perhaps there's another Shadowheart out there, that you're confusing me with.

ShadowheartMindWiped_13.speaker: Player
ShadowheartMindWiped_13.text: I'm sorry. I did this to you.

ShadowheartMindWiped_38.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_38.text: Dark Lady as my witness, I have no idea what you're talking about. I think we're done here.

ShadowheartMindWiped_7.speaker: Player
ShadowheartMindWiped_7.text: Seems like you're right where you're supposed to be.

ShadowheartMindWiped_44.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_44.text: Of course I am. Now unless you've any other dazzling insights to share, I think we're done here.

ShadowheartMindWiped_22.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_22.text: Curious, this one. They seem a touch confused. Mother Superior must have some use for them.

ShadowheartMindWiped_21.speaker: Player
ShadowheartMindWiped_21.text: Use your tadpole. Seek a connection with her.

ShadowheartMindWiped_40.speaker: Narrator
ShadowheartMindWiped_40.text: *This is no act. You are an utter stranger to her. The memories you shared with her will die with you.*

ShadowheartMindWiped_30.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_30.text: What the...? The Hells do you think you're doing?!

ShadowheartMindWiped_32.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_32.text: Walk away - now. Try anything like that again and you'll find your guest privileges can be revoked very quickly.

ShadowheartMindWiped_28.speaker: Player
ShadowheartMindWiped_28.text: Forget it. In fact, it seems you already have.

ShadowheartMindWiped_36.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_36.text: You're a strange one. On your way, then.

ShadowheartMindWiped_35.speaker: Player
ShadowheartMindWiped_35.text: I'm an honoured guest. Be sure to remember that.

ShadowheartMindWiped_24.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_24.text: As long as you show Lady Shar all due respect, you'll be treated accordingly. Now, unless there's something else...

ShadowheartMindWiped_18.speaker: Player
ShadowheartMindWiped_18.text: Don't you recognise me at all?

ShadowheartMindWiped_5.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_5.text: Ah, my apparent long-lost acquaintance. Here to wax lyrical about all the good times we didn't share?

ShadowheartMindWiped_45.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_45.text: Let's spare the both of us the bother, shall we? Whoever you think I am... I'm not her.

ShadowheartMindWiped_11.speaker: Shadowheart
ShadowheartMindWiped_11.text: Find someplace else to stand. You may meet with an unfortunate accident if you linger here.

Trainee_005_0.speaker: Sharran Novice Garrigan
Trainee_005_0.text: I can't believe I actually kissed you once. May Lady Shar scour my tongue.

Trainee_005_1.speaker: Sharran Novice Garrigan
Trainee_005_1.text: I have nothing more to say to you, heretic.

Trainee_005_2.speaker: Sharran Novice Garrigan
Trainee_005_2.text: What comes next for us, I wonder...?

Trainee_005_3.speaker: Sharran Novice Garrigan
Trainee_005_3.text: You are a sight to behold, my lady. Standing before you is like standing before the Dark Lady herself.

Trainee_005_4.speaker: Sharran Novice Garrigan
Trainee_005_4.text: Lady Shar may have blessed you, but I know you're still the same little girl who had nightmares about wolves.

Trainee_005_5.speaker: Sharran Novice Garrigan
Trainee_005_5.text: May your leadership usher in a new era of dark wonders, my lady.

Trainee_005_6.speaker: Sharran Novice Garrigan
Trainee_005_6.text: Speak not. Idle words are for those who cling to the light. Here, we respect silence.

Trainee_005_7.speaker: Sharran Novice Garrigan
Trainee_005_7.text: The runt of the litter now wishes to be the leader of the pack. Impressive.

Trainee_005_8.speaker: Sharran Novice Garrigan
Trainee_005_8.text: What business do you have here?

PAD_TortureRoom_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_TortureRoom_0.text: I... I think I might have hurt people here. Learned how to break their bodies, their spirits...
PAD_TortureRoom_0.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH abandoned Shar. Quietly horrified. Grasping at a fragment of memory that suggests she once tortured people in this place

PAD_TortureRoom_2.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_TortureRoom_2.text: Quiet in here now. But it wasn't always so. Screams rang off these walls. I swear I can almost hear them.
PAD_TortureRoom_2.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH abandoned Shar. Quietly horrified. Grasping at a fragment of memory that suggests she once tortured people in this place

PAD_TortureRoom_1.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_TortureRoom_1.text: I learned how to inflict pain here, for Lady Shar. I can't remember the faces... but I think I can still hear the screams.
PAD_TortureRoom_1.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH is loyal to Shar. Thoughtful. Grasping at something stirred from her memory while in a torture training room

PAD_TortureRoom_3.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_TortureRoom_3.text: A disquietening place... but you must inflict pain in order to end pain. Lady Shar's embrace can soothe all mortal torments.
PAD_TortureRoom_3.context: NodeContext: Arc: SH is loyal to Shar. T Thoughtful. Grasping at something stirred from her memory while in a torture training room

AD_SwearFealty_SharranTrainee_004_0.speaker: Sharran Novice Dollay
AD_SwearFealty_SharranTrainee_004_0.text: I am your servant, to my last breath and beyond.
AD_SwearFealty_SharranTrainee_004_0.context: NodeContext: Fervent declaration of loyaly. 'All hail the queen'

PAD_OutfitRoom_0.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_OutfitRoom_0.text: A cunning disguise can serve a warrior of the Dark Lady better than any armour. That's what they always told us.
PAD_OutfitRoom_0.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Memory stirred by a room full of costumes and disguises. Arc - abandoned shar.

PAD_OutfitRoom_3.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_OutfitRoom_3.text: I think this was my favourite part - putting these on, pretending to be someone else. I suppose that's been my whole life.
PAD_OutfitRoom_3.context: NodeContext: Fond half-remembered memories, hitting a sour note at the end. Arc - abandoned shar.

PAD_OutfitRoom_2.speaker: Shadowheart
